item.title: Baerbock: “We stand united - as Baltic region states, as the EU and as NATO”
item.description: Following an oil tanker incident in the Baltic Sea, German Foreign Minister Baerbock said that Russia was circumventing sanctions and accepting the possibility of environmental damage.
item.dc:creator: Anonymous

item.title: Germany supplies additional munitions to Ukraine
item.description: The Ukraine Defense Contact Group met at the US Ramstein Air Base in Germany and agreed on additional military aid.
item.dc:creator: Anonymous

item.title: Germany’s Africa policy: forging partnerships together
item.description: Current information about Germany’s foreign policy and foreign relations.
item.dc:creator: Anonymous

item.title: Start-up numbers rising strongly
item.description: Despite a challenging financial environment for founders, the number of start-ups in Germany has rebounded.
item.dc:creator: Anonymous

item.title: CES: innovation champion Germany
item.description: The organisers of the CES trade fair in Las Vegas rate Germany as one of the most innovative countries in the world.
item.dc:creator: Anonymous

item.title: Study: Germany hits climate target
item.description: German greenhouse gas emissions have almost halved against 1990 levels. But there is still room for improvement in climate action.
item.dc:creator: Anonymous

item.title: Germany undertakes key role in satellite communications
item.description: Cologne will be the site for the EU’s new IRIS² ground infrastructure hub.

item.title: German energy balance for 2024: record proportion of renewable energies
item.description: The energy transition in Germany is picking up pace: solar and wind power dominate the German electricity market.
item.dc:creator: Anonymous

item.title: More women on the management boards of DAX companies
item.description: Women now make up a quarter of the executive board members of Germany’s largest publicly traded companies.
item.dc:creator: Anonymous

item.title: Employment figures for 2024 hit historic peak.
item.description: Despite the economic downturn, employment in Germany rose to a new record high last year.
item.dc:creator: Anonymous
